name: 閱讀與寫作教學：理論與實務
description:
This graduate-level course will introduce students to second language reading and writing, including theory, research, and practical applications in the field. The class will be conducted in a seminar format and students are expected to lead as well as actively participate in class discussion.   Students will also have opportunities to further explore an issue of their interest in a final written assignment. The reading materials will include empirical studies as well as book chapters.

This course is designed to explore the nature of writing, methods and techniques of teaching ESL/EFL writing as well as assessment of writing, feedback, and revising. Also included in the course content are issues regarding syllabus design and building of a writing curriculum. The instructor hopes with reading thinking on all the topics in the course , the teachers on completing the course can be equipped with better expertise of teaching ESL/EFL writing and the ability to teach reflectively.
The class is conducted as lecture/discussion. A reading packet will be compiled as a major text for this course. The reading materials in the packet will include book chapters and articles on ESL/EFL writing. We will read, analyze, and discuss a couple of articles in each meeting.
goals: To introduce student with theories and research in the field of second language writing.
To provide students with pedagogical knowledge of designing writing activities and tasks as well as writing assessment.
syllabus:
**Course Description:**

        Teaching Reading and Writing in ESL/EFL Contexts provides an introduction to issues and strategies of reading and writing instruction in a wide variety of contexts. The class will be conducted in a seminar format and students are expected to lead as well as actively participate in Quality Talk discussions. The reading materials will include empirical studies as well as book chapters. Students will have opportunities to conduct a final project to further explore an issue of their interest.

**Grading Policy:**

*   Participation                     20%
*   Assignments                     20%
*   Presentation                      10%
*   Research Proposal            25%
*   Final Project                      25%

**Research Proposal:**

A statement of the research problem, a review of literature, research questions, research method, timelines, and expected outcomes and their importance.

**Final Project:**

Option 1: A Course Proposal

A course proposal that presents a comprehensive plan for an L2 reading and/or writing course in a specific context (elementary, secondary, tertiary), including the rationale, a description of the student population, a sample syllabus, and other teaching materials.

Option 2: Develop a New Writing Curriculum for the Dept. of English, NTNU

Current Writing Curriculum

\*Freshmen Year: Guided Writing (paragraph writing, 2 credits/semester)

\*Sophomore Year: Intermediate Writing (essay writing, 2 credits/semester)

\*Junior Year: Advanced Writing (functional writing, 2 credits/semester)
